A couple of days before leaving I realized I had forgotten to book it, and the price had jumped by about 30% - so I decided to leave it and gamble we would find somewhere either when we arrived, and I would keep an eye on websites for deals. About a week before we arrived I checked Expedia and found the Solamar hotel, for the original price we had been looking at. At least I thought I had! I had actually booked the Palomar. After some e-mail checking to ensure we had booked the correct hotel (there is also a Palomar in San Fran I believe) we arrived at the Palomar. First thing we found was there was no car park. I'm not a fan of valet parking, as I am more than capable of parking a car, however the guys were very helpful with the parking, and gave me directions to the car park they use, and I managed to get 2 nights and 3 days (Thurs, Fri and Sat) for $30 pre paid - multiple entry. Check-in was very pleasant, and we were well looked after. The room was large, well decorated, free wi-fi, and clean. Looked like it had recently been decorated. The whole hotel was very, very nice, and in a great location for Gaslamp district. 2nd Kimpton on our trip, and very impressed. Knowing we would be checking out at lunchtime and sitting round the pool all day, we asked about access to somewhere to shower before we left and were told they would check with the Spa to see if we could use this, when we came to check out. On the Friday afternoon we went and sat by the pool, had a couple of drinks and relaxed. Perfect for what we wanted the following day. Unfortunately what we had not accounted for was that Saturday is obviously posing day by the pool. Lots of drunk, loud showy off people. Not the hotels fault - it was just the clientele that were there that day. So not as relaxing as we hoped, and only a small part of the pool area was in the Sun so we had to fight for a spot. Pool is nice though, and bar staff very welcoming. When we came to leave we were given access to the Spa to take a shower before we left. All in all I would probably give this place a 4.5 if there was a rating, but due to the staff helpfulness there (Valet guys giving their information for car park, and Nicole on reception for all of her assistance with Spa access, and other stupid questions I had!) - I will push the rating to a 5. Will definitely seek out Kimpton hotels as our chain of choice when in the US in future.

Reviews.Title: “Great modern hotel with great service and all facilities we wanted.”
Reviews.Author: dg252
Reviews.Content: We had a great suite. Service was great - eg we asked at the front desk for some hot water to make tea, it arrived only a couple minutes after we'd got up to our room. Staff weren't entirely knowledgeable on the area (got a supermarket location a block out) but wouldn't hold that against them! When we left we asked them to call a cab for us, they brought round the courtesy car to drive us to the airport for free instead! As an Inner Circle member we got all the snacks and treats we had asked for. All in all, it was just fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “A boutique hotel in the Gaslamp District”
Reviews.Author: KLGri
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at this hotel when it was Se San Diego, and I have to say that it has improved since becoming a Kimpton property. The front desk staff was polite and helpful (although perhaps not quite as well-versed in the different restaurants in the area as they could be). The rooms are clean and quiet, although I did see the same piece of tomato on the floor outside the elevators for 2 days. The hotel restaurant, the Saltbox, is very good - again with a great waitstaff. And as I was there for a meeting, and we were using the catering for breakfast, breaks, and dinner, I can say that all of that food was a cut above the usual banquet offerings. The real downside to this hotel is that there are no coffeemakers in the rooms. It might seem like a little thing, but going down to the lobby to get coffee first thing in the morning is not how I like to start the day.

Reviews.Title: “Now Hotel Palomar - GREAT STAY!”
Reviews.Author: Julie F
Reviews.Content: We booked a Travelzoo deal to the Se San Diego and admittedly I was worried when I saw that the hotel had changed ownership. However, Kimpton honored every penny of our deal, including meal and drink credits, and gave us an amazing stay! We were travelling with my 20 mo old daughter and realized that a Gaslamp district hotel was unlikely to cater to kids, but they were phenomenal - even getting baby shampoo at 6:30 am for me without question. The valet service was prompt, easy and really well run and everyone we dealt with was just great. Thanks for an incredible vacation, Hotel Palomar!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Service”
Reviews.Author: sardub243
Reviews.Content: I was travelling to SD on business and didn't know anyone in the city. My 1st night there, the hostess and bartender made me feel very welcome. The rooms are awesome- sleek, modern, spacious. I signed out a bike and cruised around the city- the valet and concierge staff were all very helpful. Yes, it was a little loud on the street and the pool area on Friday night, but it didnt really bother me at all, like I see it had the other commentors- perhaps because I am a New Yorker! Unfortunately, I came down with flu-like symptoms and EVERYONE from security, to front desk to housekeeping to the restaurant staff were so helpful and courteous and just downright sweet! I was so pleasantly surprised by this :) I will be returning to this hotel for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't keep their promises”
Reviews.Author: MaxnKel
Reviews.Content: I booked a room over a month in advance, through a travel website. When I arrived at the Se to check in, I was handed a letter, and told that I was staying in another hotel quite a distance away. They said that the travel website had overbooked them. I find it very hard to believe that when I made my reservation over a month prior that they had no availability, as my reservation was confirmed. I specifically booked at the Se for the location, on 5th near all entertainment and dining. I had plans to meet friends at a restaurant right down the street for dinner. The hotel I was redirected to did not have any restaurants open at night, and there were not any bars/nightclubs nearby. Basically it was near nothing in the way of dining/entertainment. So, we ended up having to pay for a cab to go out to dinner, when we could have just walked up the street if the Se had honored my reservation. The front desk people could not have been less concerned about the inconvenience that this switch caused me. The Se should not participate with outside booking sites if they do not plan to honor their commitment. Shady business in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away...worst service... Loud pool party at night that prevents you from sleeping!”
Reviews.Author: traveling_jenni
Reviews.Content: As my boyfriend and I are sitting in the hallway after a full day of kayaking... He finally exclaimed that this is the worst hotel experience ever. I agree. This was my bday present to him as well so I feel really bad. I am writing this review while laying in bed at 11 pm at night on the 7th floor that feels like I am in the middle of a club from the pool party downstairs. Why were we in the hallway at 10:30pm? The cleaning lady didn't clean our room. Also our first night upon arrival... No glasses or cups in the room. First time ever this has happened. At breakfast, there was not a hostess and we sat ourselves waiting for five minutes. We left. This is a shame bc the hotel is part of a luxury hotel collection... We stayed at ojai resort last week which is the same group and we left exclaiming how wonderful the service was. I got this hotel on a travelzoo deal and at half the price, it was not worth it. If i paid the full $200+/night deal... I would even be more livid. This experience is pretty horrible and a waste of a weekend...and especially a special one at that. Pls stay away as far away as you can.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, just needs to figure out identity”
Reviews.Author: hotinfo
Reviews.Content: Always amazed at the widely different reviews of the same hotel. We loved it, my comments; 1) Valet service was excellent, they were very pleasant and quick on drop of and retrieval. 2) All employees of hotel demonstrated very good customer service...not one stinker in the bunch. We were there 4 nights, interacted with staff at spa, pool, front desk, bar, restaurant, housekeeping, concierge, bellmen, all did their job very well. 3) Handled the big blackout very well, city did a classy job as well. Two items that might hold them back from being a 5 star. 1) Location; they need the local area to have the gaslamp gentrification move their way..it is a bit sketchy around the hotel. 2) The biggie...need to figure out an identity..from what I could see, the clientele staying at the hotel does not fit with the weekend pool party scene...it was not an impressive sight for me on check in....never a good idea to see thick neck bouncers outside your hotel when you first show up. This is where the noise complaints come from..ok if they want to go this way, lots of money in it, but I think it will kill the hotel side of the business. Bottom line, I would go back, but only mid week to avoid the pool scene.

Reviews.Title: “2 sides to the Se”
Reviews.Author: jsvanthoff
Reviews.Content: One side: Modern, elegant, sleak. Great valet, so kind and helpful. Great concierge, comfortable beds, large bright windows in the rooms, wine tasting, great location. Other side: Expensive, poor housekeeping (we needed to call down often to get coffe cups, glasses, ect.) shower water splashed everywhere, bathroom door does not provide privacy to my desire. Charge for WiFI in the room, "Jersey Shore" pool parties that overflow to ALL other parts of the hotel, elitism from front desk staff (we were not to their standards, we are from Wisconsin), websites information is not accurate. All said. A nice trip if you can laugh off some of the others. Won't stay again. Will pay the same price to try something different that is hopefully ALL that was promised.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay-cation”
Reviews.Author: SMC0108
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I live in north SD county, but saw a deal for the Se boutique hotel in downtown and jumped on it. The room was small but beautiful and comfortable. We were only staying for one night and didn't bring that much stuff, so the size was not an issue for us. There was a free wine tasting in the lobby in the evening, which was a great surprise. The bar downstairs, Suite & Tender, is also a nice place to relax and get a drink or a small dinner. We met up with some friends and had some great food there. We also went to the spa inside the hotel, which I believe was overpriced. The service was great and the facilities are beautiful, but I've had as good or better for much less money in the past. Overall we had a great experience and would definitely recommend the Se to anyone coming to SD.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, new, and a party on the weekends”
Reviews.Author: Arthur B
Reviews.Content: Quick background - I'm 24, single, from Chicago and love to party. The hotel is very nice, uber modern as you can see from the pics. We were upgraded to a room on the 8th floor w/ a balcony overlooking the pool/nightclub (on the 4th floor below). The balcony was awesome as we were there to party and it was cool to hang out over the club. However, beware the noise level is very loud until 2am (weekends). I would imagine this is true for all pool side rooms up to the 12-14th floors and higher. The staff is very good at attempting to make guest aware of this at check-in and provide quieter accommodations if possible. The rooms are very small (and ours was one of the larger ones). Bathrooms are designed with a glass sliding door that will offer NO privacy. Just beware - you will be very close to whomever you are sharing the room with. The shower is non-traditional w/ a rain-type shower and no door so it gets water on the bathroom floor and can get cold in the shower. The service is decent at best - not what you would expect from a 4-star hotel. The staff seems to be preoccupied with running the club on weekend nights and it gets very crowded in the lobby and elevators at night (weekend) because of the club. Overall, for me the hotel was fun, very cool (different than the typical Westin catering to the business traveler). Beware of the above warnings as anyone expecting some of the typical features of a 4-star hotel (quiet, privacy, excellent service) will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Very small room”
Reviews.Author: Linda D
Reviews.Content: The rooms were so small. There is no real space to just unwind in the room unless you are laying in bed. Fortunately, we did not have the problem of being kept awake by the parties by the pool because we were there during the week. The restaurant is great...especially the breakfast burrito. So good, we ordered it three consecutive days and the server Mike was really friendly and made us feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Something new”
Reviews.Author: arthura1
Reviews.Content: It was my first stay at this hotel. It was very enjoyable. The staff was very great and helpull.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, would definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: Alyssa P
Reviews.Content: We just spent a night in San Diego, a nice weekend getaway. It's perfectly located in the Gaslamp District - on 5th Ave near all the restaurants and a few blocks from the water. The hotel was great. The staff were very helpful, even suggesting an inexpensive place for a pedicure when the spa was booked, Upon checkin, the front desk let us know that there was a late night pool party and asked if we would prefer a quiet room - a nice touch. However, we did find the hallway to be very noisy- you could hear everything. Luckily there were only 5 or 6 rooms in the wing so while it was noisy when someone walked in or out of their room, it didn't happen often. The beds are so comfortable and the room, while a bit small, was very nice. The one problem - the shower. There was no door or curtain so it was cold and flooded the bathroom. And the gym was great - had one of the best hotel workouts! Overall - great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “ALMOST THE BEST!!”
Reviews.Author: Manny S
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel was very good. When I first came here I was very impressed by the big door (although I was a bit shaken by all the homeless people on the streets) Good: - very well designed rooms - nice pool - helpful staff - nice view - big rooms - nice and big TV (for those of you who like to sit in your room all day) - house of blues nearby ( but not so close it's loud) - comfortable beds - everything is very clean and the bad: Hmmm...tricky... - hard to find parking (unless your willing to pay some money) - lots of homeless (who generely dont bug you or beg...just sit there...depressing) But mostly everything there is really good!!!! At first I thought it was a five star hotel!!!! Also, when we were there the water system was broken... and they didnt have hot water but that was only for the first two days of a week long trip :)

Reviews.Title: “a little annoyed with the room”
Reviews.Author: jeeder
Reviews.Content: My 32-year son and I stayed at the Se San Diego on July 28. We attended a Padres gamel. The room was not made for two beds; accessibility to the coffee maker was quite difficult. There is no privacy in the bathroom; the sliding door doesn't cover the bathroom entrance, much less keep the bathroom smell out of the bedroom area. The location was fine - right next to House of Blues, 7 blocks from the ballpark. Service was fine; however, this room is listed as a 4 1/2 star hotel, and it doesn't QUITE live up to the rating.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: PatientInfoSeeker
Reviews.Content: Friendly and welcoming front desk staff. Comfortable and clean room. I erroneously thought my TV was not working properly and someone was promptly sent to look at it.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting Property...”
Reviews.Author: bballtravel
Reviews.Content: First thing I hear when walking in is a guest saying, "I'm going to sue you guy's, I have a great lawyer." An older gentleman walking around who's some type of manager I assume (more on him later) merely said, "why would you want to sue us?" Not a good start.... The check in was seamless and we were offered an upgrade to a suite for $100 more. The 4th floor, apparently, is the pool floor, which is also where Siren club is located. We decided against it and stuck with our 4th floor room. The hotel did mention the 4th floor was noisy. Small room, but wasn't half-bad. The shower, like previous reviews, was not well thought out. Water all over the floor and you'd better be with someone who does not mind seeing you in the buff. The water on the floor did not bother me it is what it is. Room service menu is limited and we did not try it out. We did try calling around 1am for the limited overnight menu, but were told it's no longer available. Bummer. The bed was comfortable, but squeaky. Two of the light fixtures were unplugged, and our room was missing it's smoke detector. Simple oversight? No turndown service, either. Bummer x2 The noise from the club did not bother us. It's our belief that if you get your room via hotwire or any other discount website, you're placed on the 4th floor or anywhere near the pool. They're undesirable rooms, because anyone in their right mind would be bothered by the loud thumping and cussing and yelling from it's drunken patrons. The upsell to the larger suite for $100 more is to get you out of that mess, so to speak... Check out was a breeze. Now back to the older gentleman. He sits at a desk in the lobby, the mail man drops the mail on his desk, and he has a presence about him that adds to the Se. He's got an arrogant haughty type attitude, which fits this hotel perfectly. That's not a knock, however. It's a compliment and I'd welcome a chance to have wine with him during their free wine tasting on Friday. I'd come back if I got a good deal. We got $104 a night through hotwire.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & even better price”
Reviews.Author: guccichik
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location! We were in town for a baseball game and wanted to be able to walk to Petco Park and that we did. The hotel is located in the Gaslamp District so there is plenty to do. The hotel has a great pool and cool lounge that is paired with an innovative restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but not the best location...”
Reviews.Author: dmh114
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at Se in May of 2011 for our anniversary. The hotel is very chic & trendy. Our room was very nice & spacious. The view wasn't the greatest, but that is what happens when you are staying in a big city. On the weekends they have a nightclub near the pool, if you stay on this side of the hotel you will hear the music until 2am or so. The hotel was within walking distance of many places to eat & drink, but if you want to go closer to the water you will need to take a taxi or the trolly. We used the trolly everyday & it was cheap & easy. I didn't think the hotel was in a great location, I didn't feel 100% safe walking in the area, plus there was a shooting near our hotel during our stay... this was rare according to everyone, but it still made us uncomfortable. Also, upon checking in they were unable to find our reservation & were going to turn us away. Thankfully, I had saved the reservation in my email & was able to show documentation. It was somewhat discouraging that they were not going to do anything for us when they couldn't find our reservation. They did end up upgrading our room, but I am not sure it was worth it. If you are looking to party, this is probably the hotel for you. If you ar e looking for more sightseeing, quiet dinners and closer to the water I would suggest staying somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “My husband and I enjoyed the room, spa and room service!”
Reviews.Author: BekahH
Reviews.Content: We wanted comfort, nice things, a chance to get away from it all.... and we found that at Se San Diego. The linens were comfy and white, the shower was super contemporary with glass and stone, and flooring was a really pretty wood. The room service food was trendy and yum... I tried the lettuce wraps. The spa was quick to get us in and we tried a massage and a facial. We loved taking walks every morning. Within walking distance was the harbor with it's dining, sightseeing and whale watching or dinner cruises as well as the San Diego Zoo.

Reviews.Title: “NEW SURPRISE in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: bicocchinaonesta
Reviews.Content: We've been in San Diego 2 times and we had some issue with the choice of the hotel. This time we've been really surprised by SE Hotel. The building is new, the position is perfect (near Gas Lamp Qt) and the deluxe sky-view room was amazing. Will come back at SE hotel for sure next time that we'll be in town. Enjoy the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Most disappointing hotel experience!”
Reviews.Author: Jsand1389
Reviews.Content: The hotel seemed decent upon check in, and the room was nice enough. However, the experience following was absolutely miserable! The first night we were treated terribly in the hotel bar, where the bartender seemed more interested in getting off of work than treating the customers with care. He was extremely rude. The following night over shadowed the previous with flying colors. We returned to our room after an entire day out in San diego only to find a room that had not been cleaned. Upon calling the front desk, the "manager" accused me of having left the do not disturb sign on the door. His only offer was to send up 2 fresh towels and expected me to be satisfied by that. After spending $200 a night, and $36 on parking alone... I was livid. I would advise against this hotel to any friend or family member for many reasons, but primarily because of the extreme disrespect I felt from the staff. DO NOT SPEND YOUR MONEY TO STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service, beautifully modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: clemsonfamily
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a business event at the convention center. Loved my time at the Se! Staff were super-observant and anticipated possible needs. My bed was extremely comfortable. My room was on the 13th floor and very quiet. The complimentary wine in the evening is a lovely way to end a busy day. Shout out to Michael, concierge, for all his assistance. There is a pool party on weekends, and I saw a lot of people having a good time, but did not participate. Pool and surrounding area is beautiful. Hotel is convenient to two drug stores and a 7-11 store to pick up snacks and drinks to go. Within a 6 block walk to the restaurant district, but about 10 to the convention center. Spent 1 day at the Zoo, which I highly recommend.

HotelInfo.Name: Palomar San Diego, A Kimpton Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 1047 5th Avenue, San Diego, CA 92101
